commitResults.messageTitle: [200~Add Task class and improve task handling in Alpha
Add ToDo.java, Event.java adn Deadline.java Update Task.java and Alpha.java
Upate Alpha.java to add delete method
Adjust to the java coding style
Use Java assert to document important assumptions
commitResults.messageBody:
Parts of the code rely on assumptions about states and arguments but lack explicit checks. Without runtime validation, these assumptions can be overlooked, risking subtle bugs.

This commit adds Java assert statements to relevant methods in classes such as Alpha, Main, and TaskList to highlight these assumptions. Doing so clarifies developer intent and helps detect issues early when assertions are enabled.

Let's also add new images (ikaros.png, yui.png) for the main windowâ€™s UI enhancements and update build.gradle to ensure they are packaged properly.

commitResults.messageTitle: A-CodeQuality: refine Alpha structure and introduce Command class
commitResults.messageBody:
Alpha handles multiple responsibilities, making code maintenance harder. The data file (alpha.txt) also lacks clarity about how commands are processed, causing confusion when new features are introduced.

A clearer separation of concerns is needed to improve code quality and simplify future enhancements.

We introduce a Command class to encapsulate command handling while updating Alpha to delegate command-related tasks. The alpha.txt file is also refined to align with the new command architecture.

Following established code quality practices ensures the codebase remains maintainable. Extracting command logic into its own class clarifies each component's purpose and makes the system easier to extend.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Storage to use Java Streams
commitResults.messageBody:
Storage operations previously used traditional loops and manual
collection handling, leading to verbosity and reduced readability.

Using Java Streams improves code clarity, reduces boilerplate,
and enhances maintainability.

Let's refactor Storage to leverage Streams for more concise
and expressive data processing.
Refactor Storage to use Java Streams

TaskList previously allowed duplicate tasks to be added without any
checks. This could lead to cluttered task lists and redundant entries,
making task management inefficient.

A duplicate detection mechanism is now implemented to check if a task
already exists before adding it. When a duplicate is detected, the
system prompts the user for confirmation before proceeding with the
addition.

Let's modify TaskList to:
- Detect duplicate tasks using their string representation.
- Prompt the user through the UI to confirm whether to add the duplicate.
- Integrate this feature into the Command class for better usability.
- Update unit tests in TaskListTest to verify the new behavior.

This change ensures better task organization and prevents unintended
duplicate entries while still allowing users to manually override the
check if needed.
